  • Mapping the Systematic Literature Studies about Software Ecosystems

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Alicia García-Holgado
    Autor Francisco J. García-Peñalvo
    Resumo There is a need to improve the definition and development of technological ecosystems in order to solve the main problems detected in previous studies. To achieve this goal, it is required to identify and analyse the solutions available in the literature in the field of software engineering applied to ecosystems. The research in software ecosystems is a relatively young research area, but there are already several works that analyse the literature associated. To conduct a new systematic literature review is necessary to ensure that there are no studies that do the same, namely, that do not answer the same research questions. The identification of the need for a review was done through a study focused on systematic literature reviews and mapping studies about software ecosystems. This work aims to describe the mapping conducted as part of that study. It provides a global state of the art of this kind of studies in the area of software ecosystems.
    Data 2018
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3284179.3284330
    Extra event-place: Salamanca, Spain
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-6518-5
    Páginas 910–918
    Série TEEM'18
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the Sixth International Conference on Technological Ecosystems for Enhancing Multiculturality
    DOI 10.1145/3284179.3284330
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:43:43
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 12:25:03

    Etiquetas:

    • ACM
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • software ecosystems
    • software engineering
    • systematic literature review
    • systematic mapping
    • Technological ecosystems

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      There is a need to improve the definition and development of technological ecosystems in order to solve the main problems detected in previous studies. To achieve this goal, it is required to identify and analyse the solutions available in the literature in the field of software engineering applied to ecosystems. The research in software ecosystems is a relatively young research area, but there are already several works that analyse the literature associated. To conduct a new systematic literature review is necessary to ensure that there are no studies that do the same, namely, that do not answer the same research questions. The identification of the need for a review was done through a study focused on systematic literature reviews and mapping studies about software ecosystems. This work aims to describe the mapping conducted as part of that study. It provides a global state of the art of this kind of studies in the area of software ecosystems.

  • Measurement-Based Experiments on the Mobile Web: A Systematic Mapping Study

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Omar De Munk
    Autor Ivano Malavolta
    Resumo The mobile Web is growing as more and more people use a smart device to access online services. This rapid growth of mobile Web usage is accompanied by the evolution of the mobile Web browser as a fully fledged software platform. Due to these two trends, the expectations of users in terms of quality of experience (QoE) when browsing the Web on their mobile device has increased drastically. As a result, the number of studies using measurement-based experiments to investigate the factors influencing QoE has grown. However, conducting measurement-based experiments on the mobile Web is not a trivial task as it requires a significant experience and knowledge about both technical and methodological aspects. Unfortunately, there is no systematic study on the state of the art of conducting measurement-based experiments on the mobile Web that could guide researchers and practitioners when planning and performing such experiments. The goal of this work is to build a map of existing studies that conduct measurement-based experiments on the mobile Web. In total 640 potentially relevant studies are identified. After a rigorous selection procedure the set of primary studies consists of 28 papers from which we extracted data and gathered insights. Specifically, we investigate on (i) which metrics are collected, how they are measured, and how they are analysed, (ii) the platforms on which the experiments are run, (iii) what subjects are used, and (iv) the used tools and environments under which the experiments are run. This study benefits researchers and practitioners by presenting common techniques, empirical practices, and tools to properly conduct measurement-based experiments on the mobile Web.
    Data 2021
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3463274.3463318
    Extra event-place: Trondheim, Norway
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-9053-8
    Páginas 191–200
    Série EASE '21
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the 25th International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering
    DOI 10.1145/3463274.3463318
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:43:31
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 10:32:27

    Etiquetas:

    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • ACM

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      The mobile Web is growing as more and more people use a smart device to access online services. This rapid growth of mobile Web usage is accompanied by the evolution of the mobile Web browser as a fully fledged software platform. Due to these two trends, the expectations of users in terms of quality of experience (QoE) when browsing the Web on their mobile device has increased drastically. As a result, the number of studies using measurement-based experiments to investigate the factors influencing QoE has grown. However, conducting measurement-based experiments on the mobile Web is not a trivial task as it requires a significant experience and knowledge about both technical and methodological aspects. Unfortunately, there is no systematic study on the state of the art of conducting measurement-based experiments on the mobile Web that could guide researchers and practitioners when planning and performing such experiments. The goal of this work is to build a map of existing studies that conduct measurement-based experiments on the mobile Web. In total 640 potentially relevant studies are identified. After a rigorous selection procedure the set of primary studies consists of 28 papers from which we extracted data and gathered insights. Specifically, we investigate on (i) which metrics are collected, how they are measured, and how they are analysed, (ii) the platforms on which the experiments are run, (iii) what subjects are used, and (iv) the used tools and environments under which the experiments are run. This study benefits researchers and practitioners by presenting common techniques, empirical practices, and tools to properly conduct measurement-based experiments on the mobile Web.

  • Mediated Reality Mirror: Towards a Study with Autistic Users

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Doga Corlu
    Autor Beste Ozdeslik
    Autor Asim Evren Yantac
    Autor Morten Fjeld
    Resumo Open offices, despite their tangible advantages, are challenging for autistic individuals due to continuous visual and social interruptions. In order to filter out these distractions and enhance autistics' attention and communication with their coworkers, here we introduce the mediated reality mirror (MRM) concept deriving from the inspiring developments in diminished and augmented reality. We conducted two bodystorming workshops and interviews with 14 non-autistic participants in order to inform the design process of MRM and our future studies with autistics which is a one shot opportunity. In this paper we present the outcomes of the workshops and the interviews as well as their contributions to our future studies with autistic users of MRM.
    Data 2016
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/2971485.2996743
    Extra event-place: Gothenburg, Sweden
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-4763-1
    Série NordiCHI '16
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the 9th Nordic Conference on Human-Computer Interaction
    DOI 10.1145/2971485.2996743
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 11:00:08
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 10:24:51

    Etiquetas:

    • assistive technologies
    • Autism
    • workshop
    • attention
    • bodystorming
    • diminished reality
    • mediated reality
    • open office
    • sensory-perception
    • spatial augmented reality
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • ACM

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      Open offices, despite their tangible advantages, are challenging for autistic individuals due to continuous visual and social interruptions. In order to filter out these distractions and enhance autistics' attention and communication with their coworkers, here we introduce the mediated reality mirror (MRM) concept deriving from the inspiring developments in diminished and augmented reality. We conducted two bodystorming workshops and interviews with 14 non-autistic participants in order to inform the design process of MRM and our future studies with autistics which is a one shot opportunity. In this paper we present the outcomes of the workshops and the interviews as well as their contributions to our future studies with autistic users of MRM.

  • Microservice Architecture: A Tertiary Study

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Diego Ivo Campos Costa
    Autor Eduardo Pereira e Silva Filho
    Autor Reginaldo Florencio da Silva
    Autor Thiago Dias de C. Quaresma Gama
    Autor Mariela I. Cortés
    Resumo Context. The large-scale use of microservices and their increasing adoption in the industry in recent years has motivated researches on the most diverse aspects related to microservice-based development. However, as it is a relatively new topic, there is still no consolidated body of knowledge in the area. Objective. The present work intends to investigate the current state of research on microservices based on the formulation of six research questions covering fundamental aspects, such as: main interest topics and adopted standards, techniques and tools have been used and application areas. Method. From four digital libraries, 22 secondary studies were selected as a data source, which were analyzed and synthesized in the present study following the proposed research protocol. Results. Among the main topics of interest addressed, we highlight researches related to the applicability of microservice architecture, both by industry and academia. Results indicated that standards focus on challenges related to communication have been the most commonly considered by researchers of the area. Finally, the predominance in the use of the Docker container and the presence of DevOps practices in the automation of operations are noteworthy. Conclusions. The present mapping study points to some directions of research based on the identified gaps, such as modeling and testing of microservice applications, and addressing security aspects. Another promising point to be explored involves the combined use of microservice architecture with other related concepts such as IoT, smart cities, FOG computing and reactive systems, in order to reinforce the use of microservices, as well as creating new solutions and challenges to be researched.
    Data 2020
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3425269.3425277
    Extra event-place: Natal, Brazil
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-8754-5
    Páginas 61–70
    Série SBCARS '20
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the 14th Brazilian Symposium on Software Components, Architectures, and Reuse
    DOI 10.1145/3425269.3425277
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:44:16
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 10:25:15

    Etiquetas:

    • Academia
    • Arquitetura de software
    • Industria
    • Mapeamento sistemático
    • Microsserviços
    • Padrões de arquitetura
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • ACM

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      Context. The large-scale use of microservices and their increasing adoption in the industry in recent years has motivated researches on the most diverse aspects related to microservice-based development. However, as it is a relatively new topic, there is still no consolidated body of knowledge in the area. Objective. The present work intends to investigate the current state of research on microservices based on the formulation of six research questions covering fundamental aspects, such as: main interest topics and adopted standards, techniques and tools have been used and application areas. Method. From four digital libraries, 22 secondary studies were selected as a data source, which were analyzed and synthesized in the present study following the proposed research protocol. Results. Among the main topics of interest addressed, we highlight researches related to the applicability of microservice architecture, both by industry and academia. Results indicated that standards focus on challenges related to communication have been the most commonly considered by researchers of the area. Finally, the predominance in the use of the Docker container and the presence of DevOps practices in the automation of operations are noteworthy. Conclusions. The present mapping study points to some directions of research based on the identified gaps, such as modeling and testing of microservice applications, and addressing security aspects. Another promising point to be explored involves the combined use of microservice architecture with other related concepts such as IoT, smart cities, FOG computing and reactive systems, in order to reinforce the use of microservices, as well as creating new solutions and challenges to be researched.

  • MiD: Enabling Integration between Web Systems

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Irvayne Matheus de Sousa Ibiapina
    Autor Pedro de Alcântara dos Santos Neto
    Autor Guillerme Avelino
    Autor Ricardo Britto
    Resumo Technological solutions are increasingly present in everyday corporate environments. These solutions assist in a variety of activities that are of paramount importance to your employees, customers and partners. However, as demands grow, the complexity of business needs increases, and as a result, technology systems need to evolve to maintain the standard of service quality. In this sense, the integration between systems is an alternative to help in this evolutionary scenario, enabling the sharing of resources between different systems, contemplating interoperability, reducing unwanted redundancies and eliminating bottlenecks and incompatibilities. However, despite the advantages and benefits, there are some inherent difficulties to achieve integration, which are: the effort spent on development, the integration process with Legacy Systems, the risks associated with software modifications and the integration with software developed by third parties. Because of this, we propose an approach and a tool, called MiD, to overcome such difficulties inherent in building Web Services. MiD simplifies the development of Web Services for integration between Web systems, enabling integration without the need for access to target system source code and low cost development and maintenance. An evaluation was performed to verify the advantages of using MiD in a real integration project. Preliminary results show that for the context used in the assessment environment, MiD has the potential to reduce effort in developing Web Services for integration.
    Data 2020
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3411564.3411652
    Extra event-place: São Bernardo do Campo, Brazil
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-8873-3
    Série SBSI '20
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the XVI Brazilian Symposium on Information Systems
    DOI 10.1145/3411564.3411652
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 11:00:12
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 12:47:31

    Etiquetas:

    • ACM
    • Integrations Systems
    • Legacy Systems
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • Web Services

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      Technological solutions are increasingly present in everyday corporate environments. These solutions assist in a variety of activities that are of paramount importance to your employees, customers and partners. However, as demands grow, the complexity of business needs increases, and as a result, technology systems need to evolve to maintain the standard of service quality. In this sense, the integration between systems is an alternative to help in this evolutionary scenario, enabling the sharing of resources between different systems, contemplating interoperability, reducing unwanted redundancies and eliminating bottlenecks and incompatibilities. However, despite the advantages and benefits, there are some inherent difficulties to achieve integration, which are: the effort spent on development, the integration process with Legacy Systems, the risks associated with software modifications and the integration with software developed by third parties. Because of this, we propose an approach and a tool, called MiD, to overcome such difficulties inherent in building Web Services. MiD simplifies the development of Web Services for integration between Web systems, enabling integration without the need for access to target system source code and low cost development and maintenance. An evaluation was performed to verify the advantages of using MiD in a real integration project. Preliminary results show that for the context used in the assessment environment, MiD has the potential to reduce effort in developing Web Services for integration.

  • Mobile Application Accessibility in the Context of Visually Impaired Users

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Cláudia Ferreira da Silva
    Autor Simone B. Leal Ferreira
    Autor Carolina Sacramento
    Resumo The use of smartphones as a technological resource not only provides access to information and services but has also improved the quality of life of people with visual disabilities, allowing them to be more independent in daily activities. The objective of this research was to characterize the problems that visually impaired users encounter when using mobile applications and relate them to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, in order to identify possible gaps that make the guidelines insufficient to solve all users' difficulties. Mercado Livre was the application selected as object of study and five sessions of accessibility evaluation involving visually impaired users were carried out. The results demonstrated that many problems experienced by users could be related to violations of accessibility guidelines of the WCAG 2.0 as long as they were adapted to the context of mobile applications. Considering the importance of accessible mobile applications, we observed the need to extend studies that support developers and designers in achieving better accessibility in user interface design for users of assistive technologies, such as screen readers.
    Data 2018
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3274192.3274224
    Extra event-place: Belém, Brazil
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-6601-4
    Série IHC 2018
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the 17th Brazilian Symposium on Human Factors in Computing Systems
    DOI 10.1145/3274192.3274224
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:59:59
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 10:28:27

    Etiquetas:

    • Accessibility
    • mobile applications
    • visual impairment
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • ACM

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      The use of smartphones as a technological resource not only provides access to information and services but has also improved the quality of life of people with visual disabilities, allowing them to be more independent in daily activities. The objective of this research was to characterize the problems that visually impaired users encounter when using mobile applications and relate them to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, in order to identify possible gaps that make the guidelines insufficient to solve all users' difficulties. Mercado Livre was the application selected as object of study and five sessions of accessibility evaluation involving visually impaired users were carried out. The results demonstrated that many problems experienced by users could be related to violations of accessibility guidelines of the WCAG 2.0 as long as they were adapted to the context of mobile applications. Considering the importance of accessible mobile applications, we observed the need to extend studies that support developers and designers in achieving better accessibility in user interface design for users of assistive technologies, such as screen readers.

  • Mobile Application Development Training in Mobile Software Ecosystem: Investigating the Developer EXperience

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Awdren Fontão
    Autor Bruno Bonifácio
    Autor Rodrigo Pereira dos Santos
    Autor Arilo Claudio Dias-Neto
    Resumo In a Mobile Software Ecosystem (MSECO), large software organizations (or keystones) need to attract/coach external developers to meet users' demands. In this scenario, it is necessary to evaluate developers' experiences during their involvement in trainings as a strategy to engage developers to contribute to the MSECO expansion (quantitatively and qualitatively). In this paper, we report a study on the comparison of a process-based approach for training mobile application developers in MSECO against an ad hoc approach (developer's and evangelist's personal processes) to analyze the effect of evangelist-developers interaction in MSECO from Developer experience (DX). We also propose a set of steps to assist keystone organizations to govern developers based on DX sources and with evangelists' support in trainings.
    Data 2018
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3275245.3275262
    Extra event-place: Curitiba, Brazil
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-6565-9
    Páginas 160–169
    Série SBQS '18
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the XVII Brazilian Symposium on Software Quality
    DOI 10.1145/3275245.3275262
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:44:05
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 12:15:08

    Etiquetas:

    • Software ecosystem
    • mobile app
    • training
    • developer experience
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • ACM

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      In a Mobile Software Ecosystem (MSECO), large software organizations (or keystones) need to attract/coach external developers to meet users' demands. In this scenario, it is necessary to evaluate developers' experiences during their involvement in trainings as a strategy to engage developers to contribute to the MSECO expansion (quantitatively and qualitatively). In this paper, we report a study on the comparison of a process-based approach for training mobile application developers in MSECO against an ad hoc approach (developer's and evangelist's personal processes) to analyze the effect of evangelist-developers interaction in MSECO from Developer experience (DX). We also propose a set of steps to assist keystone organizations to govern developers based on DX sources and with evangelists' support in trainings.

  • Mobile Applications in the Care of Children and Teenagers in Oncological Treatment

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Paula A. Knob
    Autor Andrêsa V. Larentis
    Autor Débora N. F. Barbosa
    Autor Carla R. da Silva
    Autor Jorge L. V. Barbosa
    Resumo Cancer is the disease that most affects children and young people around the world. The treatment is long and ineffective when detected late. The technologies of mobile computing can be used to develop applications to assist patients during the cancer treatment. This article presents a systematic mapping of literature to identify articles that apply mobile applications to assist patients in cancer treatments, in order to show an overview of the literature, identifying gaps and research opportunities. The systematic mapping study was conducted in six databases including papers from January 2008 to December 2018. The initial search resulted in 41,888 papers, of which 31 were selected after applying the filter criteria. The main results obtained are: (1) most papers (61,29%) reported solutions based on native mobile applications; (2) majority (67,74%) focused on monitoring symptoms and side effects of cancer treatment; (3) most papers (61,29%) aimed physical benefits; (4) only two papers (6,45%) provided applications to leukemia patients; (5) four papers (12,9%) focused on palliative care; and (6) most papers (83,87%) conducted an experiment with oncological patients. The results corroborate with the need for mobile applications to help individuals in monitoring, psychological support, and information regarding about the disease, as well as evidence of research opportunities in palliative and supportive care.
    Data 2019
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3323503.3349558
    Extra event-place: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-6763-9
    Páginas 125–132
    Série WebMedia '19
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the 25th Brazillian Symposium on Multimedia and the Web
    DOI 10.1145/3323503.3349558
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:44:11
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 12:59:30

    Etiquetas:

    • ACM
    • childhood and juvenile cancer
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • mHealth
    • sistematic mapping
    • ubiquitous computing

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      Cancer is the disease that most affects children and young people around the world. The treatment is long and ineffective when detected late. The technologies of mobile computing can be used to develop applications to assist patients during the cancer treatment. This article presents a systematic mapping of literature to identify articles that apply mobile applications to assist patients in cancer treatments, in order to show an overview of the literature, identifying gaps and research opportunities. The systematic mapping study was conducted in six databases including papers from January 2008 to December 2018. The initial search resulted in 41,888 papers, of which 31 were selected after applying the filter criteria. The main results obtained are: (1) most papers (61,29%) reported solutions based on native mobile applications; (2) majority (67,74%) focused on monitoring symptoms and side effects of cancer treatment; (3) most papers (61,29%) aimed physical benefits; (4) only two papers (6,45%) provided applications to leukemia patients; (5) four papers (12,9%) focused on palliative care; and (6) most papers (83,87%) conducted an experiment with oncological patients. The results corroborate with the need for mobile applications to help individuals in monitoring, psychological support, and information regarding about the disease, as well as evidence of research opportunities in palliative and supportive care.

  • Mobile Apps Repository for Older People

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Miguel Á. Conde
    Autor F. J. García-Peñalvo
    Autor V. Matellán-Olivera
    Resumo Information and Communication Technology have had a special impact in our society and even in our daily life. Technologies such as mobile devices, or Internet provide us with services everywhere and every time, they help us to contact with other people, to access information, etc. However not all the people use these technologies in the same way. Older people are not born in the technological age and use technology partially. For them technology can be something exclusive. In order to avoid this it is necessary to develop initiatives that bring the older people closer to the technologies. This can be achieved taken into account their special features, needs and interests. The present project is one of those initiatives. It aims to provide older people with a repository of mobile apps classified attending to their personal special features and to their needs. Moreover the repository takes into account older people opinion to classify the tools. In order to implement it Drupal was used and several apps have been classified and added into it. From this experience and the interaction with older people it was possible to see that they can and want to use new technologies to make easier their daily life, but technology should be adapted to them.
    Data 2014
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/2669711.2669981
    Extra event-place: Salamanca, Spain
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-2896-8
    Páginas 725–731
    Série TEEM '14
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the Second International Conference on Technological Ecosystems for Enhancing Multiculturality
    DOI 10.1145/2669711.2669981
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 11:00:10
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 10:23:39

    Etiquetas:

    • ICT
    • mobile devices
    • apps
    • older people
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • ACM

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      Information and Communication Technology have had a special impact in our society and even in our daily life. Technologies such as mobile devices, or Internet provide us with services everywhere and every time, they help us to contact with other people, to access information, etc. However not all the people use these technologies in the same way. Older people are not born in the technological age and use technology partially. For them technology can be something exclusive. In order to avoid this it is necessary to develop initiatives that bring the older people closer to the technologies. This can be achieved taken into account their special features, needs and interests. The present project is one of those initiatives. It aims to provide older people with a repository of mobile apps classified attending to their personal special features and to their needs. Moreover the repository takes into account older people opinion to classify the tools. In order to implement it Drupal was used and several apps have been classified and added into it. From this experience and the interaction with older people it was possible to see that they can and want to use new technologies to make easier their daily life, but technology should be adapted to them.

  • Mobili: Development and Use of a Usability Checklist for Mobile Games and Applications

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Nayana Carneiro
    Autor Bianca Melo
    Autor Letícia Cavalcante
    Autor Rute Castro
    Autor Rossana M. C. Andrade
    Autor Ticianne Darin
    Resumo Given the expansion of the Brazilian mobile development market and its dynamic context, it is essential to use interaction design and evaluation methods that suit the industry’s needs and allow companies to design high-quality applications while continuously evolving them. The present work reports our experience of developing the Mobili checklist and applying it within a software development project. Mobili offers guidance in conducting heuristic evaluations in mobile games and applications, and it was applied to assist in identifying priority corrections and evolutions for the software products developed in our project. Thus, this paper aims to share lessons that can be useful for teams in similar contexts.
    Data 2021
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3439961.3439994
    Extra event-place: São Luís, Brazil
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-8923-5
    Série SBQS '20
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the XIX Brazilian Symposium on Software Quality
    DOI 10.1145/3439961.3439994
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:44:15
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 10:18:14

    Etiquetas:

    • Avaliação heurística

    • Jogos móveis

    • ACM

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      Given the expansion of the Brazilian mobile development market and its dynamic context, it is essential to use interaction design and evaluation methods that suit the industry’s needs and allow companies to design high-quality applications while continuously evolving them. The present work reports our experience of developing the Mobili checklist and applying it within a software development project. Mobili offers guidance in conducting heuristic evaluations in mobile games and applications, and it was applied to assist in identifying priority corrections and evolutions for the software products developed in our project. Thus, this paper aims to share lessons that can be useful for teams in similar contexts.

  • Modelling Competencies for Computing Education beyond 2020: A Research Based Approach to Defining Competencies in the Computing Disciplines

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Stephen Frezza
    Autor Mats Daniels
    Autor Arnold Pears
    Autor Åsa Cajander
    Autor Viggo Kann
    Autor Amanpreet Kapoor
    Autor Roger McDermott
    Autor Anne-Kathrin Peters
    Autor Mihaela Sabin
    Autor Charles Wallace
    Resumo How might the content and outcomes of tertiary education programmes be described and analysed in order to understand how they are structured and function? To address this question we develop a framework for modelling graduate competencies linked to tertiary degree programmes in the computing disciplines. While the focus of our work is computing the framework is applicable to education more broadly. The work presented here draws upon the pioneering curricular document for information technology (IT2017), curricular competency frameworks, other related documents such as the software engineering competency model (SWECOM), the Skills Framework for the Information Age (SFIA), current research in competency models, and elicitation workshop results from recent computing conferences. The aim is to inform the ongoing Computing Curricula (CC2020) project, an endeavour supported by the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) and the IEEE Computer Society. We develop the Competency Learning Framework (CoLeaF), providing an internationally relevant tool for describing competencies. We argue that this competency based approach is well suited for constructing learning environments and assists degree programme architects in dealing with the challenge of developing, describing and including competencies relevant to computer and IT professionals. In this paper we demonstrate how the CoLeaF competency framework can be applied in practice, and though a series of case studies demonstrate its effectiveness and analytical power as a tool for describing and comparing degree programmes in the international higher education landscape.
    Data 2018
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/3293881.3295782
    Extra event-place: Larnaca, Cyprus
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-6223-8
    Páginas 148–174
    Série ITiCSE 2018 Companion
    Título dos anais Proceedings Companion of the 23rd Annual ACM Conference on Innovation and Technology in Computer Science Education
    DOI 10.1145/3293881.3295782
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:44:15
    Data de modificação 13/11/2023 12:18:09

    Etiquetas:

    • CC2020
    • Computing competencies
    • curriculum guidelines
    • Professional competencies
    • Leitura Inicial - DESCARTADO
    • ACM

    Notas:

    • #nota

      Não é um artigo da área de ESS ou revisão secundária.

    • #resumo

      How might the content and outcomes of tertiary education programmes be described and analysed in order to understand how they are structured and function? To address this question we develop a framework for modelling graduate competencies linked to tertiary degree programmes in the computing disciplines. While the focus of our work is computing the framework is applicable to education more broadly. The work presented here draws upon the pioneering curricular document for information technology (IT2017), curricular competency frameworks, other related documents such as the software engineering competency model (SWECOM), the Skills Framework for the Information Age (SFIA), current research in competency models, and elicitation workshop results from recent computing conferences. The aim is to inform the ongoing Computing Curricula (CC2020) project, an endeavour supported by the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) and the IEEE Computer Society. We develop the Competency Learning Framework (CoLeaF), providing an internationally relevant tool for describing competencies. We argue that this competency based approach is well suited for constructing learning environments and assists degree programme architects in dealing with the challenge of developing, describing and including competencies relevant to computer and IT professionals. In this paper we demonstrate how the CoLeaF competency framework can be applied in practice, and though a series of case studies demonstrate its effectiveness and analytical power as a tool for describing and comparing degree programmes in the international higher education landscape.

  • Modernization of Legacy Systems: A Generalised Roadmap

    Tipo do item Conferência
    Autor Suman Jain
    Autor Inderveer Chana
    Resumo A number of key organizations are sustaining the decades old complex legacy systems despite their types of services and operating environment. Cloud computing provides numerous processes, tools and methods to emphasize upon the pay-as-per-use utility models. The utter need to modernize these older systems leads to modernization processes involving the vision to leverage the cloud computing benefits. The proposed modernization framework includes decision support module followed by the elaboration of available modernization approaches. This legacy problem is one of the main challenges for cloud computing to deal with. When re-architecting and reengineering these legacy systems, parallel computing approaches also need to be assessed for resource optimization in cloud environments.
    Data 2015
    URL https://doi.org/10.1145/2818567.2818579
    Extra event-place: Allahabad, India
    Lugar New York, NY, USA
    Editor Association for Computing Machinery
    ISBN 978-1-4503-3552-2
    Páginas 62–67
    Série ICCCT '15
    Título dos anais Proceedings of the Sixth International Conference on Computer and Communication Technology 2015
    DOI 10.1145/2818567.2818579
    Data de adição 15/10/2023 10:44:18
